sub_title: Principal Exploration Geologist at Shell International Exploration & Production B.V.
summary:
Enthusiastic and seasoned explorer with 25+ years international experience with Shell as geoscientist in a variety of jobs (operations geologist, seismic interpreter, regional geologist, regional exploration consultant/advisor, technical project leader, business opportunity manager, exploration team leader).
Versatile, creative and business-orientated geologist with strong analytical skills, commercial acumen and achievement drive.  Broad and varied background in regional/basin play analysis, identification of new exploration business opportunities to prospect evaluation and maturation, with extensive experience (17 years) across the Middle East and North Africa regions, and more recently (3 years) in the Far East region.
Well-respected and supportive team leader/player with excellent inter-personal, multi-cultural and man-management skills; strong collaborator and good communicator operating with high integrity and transparency; keen implementer of new Shell technologies; experienced technical peer reviewer and coach of less-experienced staff.
Proven track record in leading and coordinating complex exploration evaluation projects, bid round and farm-in opportunities and divestment project of Shell asset, whilst building and achieving shared visions and strategies in multi-discipline and cross-business project teams.
Built and maintained trustworthy relations with co-venturers and representatives of Governments and National Oil Companies.  Fulfilled the function of principal technical Shell shareholder representative for the SRAK (Saudi Arabia) joint venture.  Represented Shell at international conferences (technical committee member for GeoArabia 2008 and IPTC 2009) and in industry scout meetings (Malaysia).

profile_positions.description:
Project Lead / Principal Exploration Geologist in the Global Exploration Opportunity Identification Team, responsible for identifying, evaluating and assessing value of new exploration projects or opportunities.  I evaluated and reviewed the exploration potential of the Pattani Basin (offshore Thailand/Cambodia).  I am/was senior advisor/technical lead for opportunities around Iberia and for regional play based evaluation of the East Mediterranean offshore region (Turkey, Cyprus, Levant, Egypt).
In early 2016, after Shell take-over of British Gas (BG), I formed part of the Shell delegation of selected technical experts responsible for review of the BG exploration portfolio with focus on BG’s heartland areas in the North Sea sector(UK & Norway), Egypt, Tunisia and Italy.
profile_positions.title: Principal Exploration Geologist

profile_positions.description: I led a team of 8 geoscientists (new graduates to senior geoscientists) responsible for regional geological basin and play evaluations and for identification, evaluation and maturation of new exploration business opportunities (bid rounds, proactive and reactive farm-ins, equity swaps) within Malaysia territories in order to maintain and increase Shell's heartlands. As Business Opportunity Manager (BOM) I led multi-disciplinary project teams (with staff from technical, commercial, financial and legal functions) in order to determine the value of new exploration opportunities and to recommend bid levels. I represented Shell in the local scout meetings. My team collected, compiled and analysed competitive intelligence data, in order to assess competitors' focus and strategies and to maintain up to date view of yet-to-find potential within the Sabah & Sarawak regions.
profile_positions.title: Principal Exploration Geologist / Team Leader

profile_positions.description: I led a team of 5 geoscientists responsible for the evaluation of the challenging Nile Delta offshore pre-salt Oligo/Miocene plays in the non-operated ventures in NDO & NTO concessions (33% Shell share; HPHT exploration wells) and in new exploration opportunities (bid rounds, farm-ins). I was responsible for building and maintaining good relationships with BP as operator and Petronas as partner in NDO & NTO concessions and to keep the spending within budgets by proactively looking for potential savings, by implementation of new evaluation/drilling technologies and acceleration of value creation. I was also responsible as the technical lead for the dilution efforts of the Shell equity in the NDO & NTO concessions, preparing sales brochure and information memorandum and organising data rooms.
profile_positions.title: Exploration Manager Offshore NOV

profile_positions.company: Shell Exploration & Production International, Dubai, UAE
profile_positions.description: As Business Opportunity Manager (BOM) I led multi-discipline and cross-business deal teams comprising of 5-12 staff from technical, economics, commercial, financial and legal functions (e.g. Qatar bid rounds, Iran bid round, Abu Dhabi gas project). As Regional Exploration Consultant (RXC) I acted as the principal technical Shell shareholder representative for the SRAK joint venture with Saudi Aramco in Saudi Arabia, being accountable for technical integrity of all exploration activities, and demonstrating Shell's technical excellence to National Oil Company partner in the venture. As senior Geoscientist I managed the identification and maturation of new exploration business opportunities and ensure technical integrity and value delivery for Shell in assigned exploration ventures in the Middle East and South Asia regions.
profile_positions.title: Business Opportunity Manager / Principal Geologist

profile_positions.description: As Opportunity Evaluator/Advisor I led technical project teams identifying and evaluating new exploration opportunities within the North Africa and Middle East region. I developed a strong technical understanding of many different basins within the region through evaluation and screening of exploration opportunities, ranging from farm-ins (Oman, Iran, Algeria), bid rounds (Iran, Algeria, Libya), brownfield tender (Algeria) to regional prospectivity and geological framework studies (Oman, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait). The evaluations consisted of petroleum system & play analysis, developing new plays and value determination of the prospectivity and remaining potential of the area. I gained valuable experience in managing and leading technical evaluation projects, i.e. planning & coordinating work programmes and liaising with the different Shell departments. As Shell representative I gave presentations to managers of national oil companies (ADNOC, NIOC, SOC Libya) and at international conferences (GeoArabia, MENA).
profile_positions.title: Senior Exploration Geologist / Project Lead

profile_positions.description: I played a major role in the rejuvenation of the Precambrian intra-salt carbonate stringer play. I identified, evaluated and proposed for drilling the Ghafeer oil discovery, which at the time (1999) was the largest exploration find in PDO for the last 10 years. I gained experience in following through projects from seismic acquisition proposals, seismic processing, PSI reprocessing, regional prospectivity screening and prospect specific interpretation and maturation, through drilling and well testing, to final reserves booking, involving close liaison with geophysicists, drilling & reservoir engineers and production technologists. I was project leader for the Precambrian Athel silicilyte play, for which I was required to manage all exploration activities, ensuring that the subsurface evaluation (prospect/play generation, portfolio creaming, well proposals), seismic & drilling programs were optimised.
profile_positions.title: Senior Exploration Geologist / Seismic Interpreter

profile_positions.description: As a new Shell recruit I had several consecutive jobs within the Exploration Department. As seismic interpreter in a small Northern North Sea Exploration Evaluation team I was responsible for identifying, evaluating and maturing wildcat and near field exploration opportunities in Tertiary fans, Jurassic and Triassic clastics in the East Shetland Basin. As Operations Geologist I was responsible for all communications between exploration and appraisal departments in London and the operations and well engineering departments in Aberdeen and Lowestoft, producing daily operations reports for the exploration and appraisal departments. I acted as focal point for all communications with UK governmental bodies concerning obtaining approval to drill exploration and appraisal wells in the UK Offshore sector. I was focal point for communications with co-venturers on all drilling and well test activities. Typically 4 to 6 wells were operating at any one time, requiring daily attention, plus 6 to 10 other wells in various stages of planning, requiring coordination activity. As area geologist I was responsible for the geological evaluation and play analysis in the Outer Moray Firth and Quadrants 30 and 31, focusing on Lower Cretaceous Scapa sands, Upper Jurassic Fulmar sands, the Triassic sequence and the Rotliegend. I carried out studies on reservoir overpressures and on porosity/depth relations.
profile_positions.title: Exploration Geologist / Seismic Interpreter

profile_positions.description: Directly after graduating from University I was employed by Shell as a junior exploration geologist and underwent Shell’s basic training in preparation for an international career.
